intro: Manettia domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in humid, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that disperses its seeds through wind or animals.
